results.title: Covered Wagon
results.creator_credit: Famous Players-Lasky Corporation and James Cruze
results.brief_description: Recounts the journey by the men and women who left the Mississippi and Ohio valleys in 1848 to migrate to Oregon. Most of this Western epic was shot on location and captures the beauty of America’s vast frontier landscape. Essentially a romantic drama focusing on the leader of a wagon train who falls in love with the daughter of another wagon train leader. Before he can win her heart, he must clear himself of false cattle theft charges. During the journey, the wagon trains are exposed to forces of nature and the wrath of native Americans Indians defending their land against intruders. Script by Jack Cunningham based on the novel by Emerson Hough. Photographed by Karl Brown. Edited by Dorothy Arzner. Starring Alan Hale, J. Warren Kerrigan, Charles Ogle and Lois Wilson. Based on the novel by Emerson Hough.

results.title: Cover to cover looks at ... = a pet for Mrs Arbuckle ...
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Education Dept. Materials Production, Anna Grieve, John Marsh and Don Fitzsimmons
results.brief_description: Three programs from the Cover to cover series which look at three of Australia’s best known children’s books. The authors and illustrators talk about how their books evolved, the techniques they used and other aspects of their work. The three books discussed are: ‘A pet for Mrs. Arbuckle’ by Gwenda Smyth, illustrated by Anne James, ‘Five times dizzy’ by Nadia Wheatley and ‘The Inside hedge story’ by Gillian Barnett.

results.title: Cover girl
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Arthur Schwartz and Charles Vidor
results.brief_description: A chorus girl is given a chance for stardom when she is befriended by a wealthy magazine editor who used to be in love with her mother. She is torn betweeen loyalty and the secret love she has for the nightclub manager where she works, and leaving for the bright lights and fortune that will await her as a cover girl. She is faced with a difficult choice between love and fame, or can she have both? Rita Hayworth and Gene Kelly who play the star crossed lovers are well supported by Phil Silvers and Eve Arden. (Awards: Jerome Kern and Ira Gershwin for Best Musical Score)

results.title: Coventry Cathedral construction and consecration
results.brief_description: The building, embellishment and consecration of the new Cathedral Church of St. Michael at Coventry, from the preliminary earth moving in 1955 to completion seven years later, finishing with a tour of the completed cathedral, and the Consecration Ceremony attended by Her Majesty the Queen. Illuminates the contrasting skills which contributed to this achievement, and pays tribute to the architects, builders, engineers, artists and craftsmen who worked in stone and wood, glass, metal and tapestry.

results.title: Coventry cathedral
results.creator_credit: British Council, BFI and Dudley Shaw Ashton
results.brief_description: Coventry’s medieval cathedral was destroyed by air raids in 1940, but a new cathedral is being built from the design by Basil Spence. The architects model is shown and a realistic impression of the beautiful building is obtained. Spence gives an explanation of his work and he makes the point that all cathedrals were modern in their time. The work of artists and craftsmen specialising in stained glass, tapestry and stone are also shown. Commentary by Basil Spence.

results.title: Coventry and Ottobeuren join hands
results.creator_credit: F I B Dr W Lutje
results.brief_description: In 1964 the Benedictine monastery of Ottobeuren in Bavaria, celebrated its 12th centenary. Taking part in the celebrations was Princess Marina, Duchess of Kent, a manifestation of the cultural ties between Great Britain and Germany.

results.title: Cousins
results.creator_credit: Helen Atkinson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Helen Atkinson believes that family should always be close so you have someone to turn to when you need them the most. She shares a close bond with her cousin and wouldn’t have it any other way.

results.title: Cousin
results.brief_description: The childhood remembrance of a cousin, his special arm, pet rocks and shopping trolley. He was born with cerebral palsy. The narrator tells of their antics together as children: their attempts to fly off the chook shed roof, out of control shopping trolley rides as well as being introduced to his many assorted collections of tee shirts, pet rocks and toenails.

results.title: Cousin
results.creator_credit: Adam Benjamin Elliot Pty Ltd and Adam Elliot
results.brief_description: The narrator reflects back on his youth spent with a cousin who suffered from cerebral palsy. The memories evoked supply images of superheroes, liquorice smells, the way he broke a finger of someone who picked on him, and the separation that occurs as the two cousins grow older and further apart. Narrated by William McInnes. This clay animation film forms part of the autobiographical trilogy that includes “Uncle”, “Brother” and “Cousin”.
